original: bi na ya sam gra ha /
analyzed: bi na ya sam gra ha /
translated: Vinayasamgraha

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'dul ba bsdus pa /
analyzed: 'dul ba bsdus pa /
translated: Vinaya Compendium

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume One

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phags pa nyan thos thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phags pa nyan thos thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha, the Bodhisattvas, and all the noble Hearers.

original: gang gis mchog tu 'dul ba med rgyu sems can 'dus pa smad pa yi //
analyzed: gang gis mchog tu 'dul ba med rgyu sems can 'dus pa smad pa yi //
translated: By whom, the cause of supreme self-discipline, the assembly of beings is despised,

original: sems kyi thibs po'i nang du rnam par rgyu ba nub par gyur pa yi //
analyzed: sems kyi thibs po'i nang du rnam par rgyu ba nub par gyur pa yi //
translated: The one who moves within the thicket of the mind has set,

original: mun pa de yi stobs kyis ma lus pa la khyab par 'jug pa dag /'dul ba nyid ma'i 'od zer lag pas rnam gsal de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mun pa de yi stobs kyis ma lus pa la khyab par 'jug pa dag /'dul ba nyid ma'i 'od zer lag pas rnam gsal de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: By the power of that darkness, pervading all, the light rays of self-discipline's mother are illuminated, to him I pay homage.

original: don gang gzhi dang phran tshogs gleng gzhi sil bu la yod rnam par 'byed las gang gsungs dang ; / gang dag lnga pa dang ni bcu drug pa dang nye ba 'khor gyis zhus las bshad pa dang // gang dag bram ze'i bu mo dang ni 'dul byed de bzhin gang dag ma mo las bshad pa //üîΩrin chen yon tan 'od 'bar bzhin du yon tan 'bar ba de dag 'dir ni rim bzhin bzhag / so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa yongs su ma nyams pa chung ngu'i yang chung ngu la sogs pa'i rnam pa las shin tu thar par
analyzed: don gang gzhi dang phran tshogs gleng gzhi sil bu la yod rnam par 'byed las gang gsungs dang ; / gang dag lnga pa dang ni bcu drug pa dang nye ba 'khor gyis zhus las bshad pa dang // gang dag bram ze'i bu mo dang ni 'dul byed de bzhin gang dag ma mo las bshad pa // rin chen yon tan 'od 'bar bzhin du yon tan 'bar ba de dag 'dir ni rim bzhin bzhag / so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa yongs su ma nyams pa chung ngu'i yang chung ngu la sogs pa'i rnam pa las shin tu thar par
translated: The meaning of the term pratimoksa is explained in the sutra itself:üîΩThe Buddha said to Ananda:üîΩ‚ÄúAnanda, this is called pratimoksa because it completely liberates one from the minor, minor and so on nonvirtuous actions that have not already degenerated.üîΩ

original: byed pas so sor thar pa'o //
analyzed: byed pas so sor thar pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the term is that it is a liberation from the small of the small and so on, since it completely eliminates afflictions.

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de'i rjes las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas yongs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de'i rjes las byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas yongs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The term learning refers to the discernment of words and meanings by ear consciousness and mental consciousness that arises after that.

original: rnyed par dka' zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas brgya lam brgya lam na 'byung ba dang bde 'gro la sogs pa rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyed par dka' zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas brgya lam brgya lam na 'byung ba dang bde 'gro la sogs pa rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The line difficult to obtain means that a buddha is found only once in a hundred eons, and that a happy rebirth is difficult to obtain.

original: bskal pa bye ba rnams su zhes bya ba ni bskal ba chen po bye bar yang mi rnyed la brgya lam na lhag par yang mi rnyed pas mang du bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba rnams su zhes bya ba ni bskal ba chen po bye bar yang mi rnyed la brgya lam na lhag par yang mi rnyed pas mang du bstan pa'i phyir 'di gsungs so //
translated: The line even in a hundred million eons means that it is not found even in a hundred million great eons, and that it is not found even once in a hundred eons. It is stated in order to show that it is very difficult to obtain.

original: gzung ba zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don shes rab kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don shes rab kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: The line grasping means that one understands the words and their meanings with wisdom.

original: 'dzin pa 'ang zhes bya ba ni dran pas de nyid kha ton bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis yun ring du mi brjed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa 'ang zhes bya ba ni dran pas de nyid kha ton bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis yun ring du mi brjed par byed pa'o //
translated: The line holding means that one does not forget them for a long time by means of recitation and so on with mindfulness.

original: bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni de'i don lus dang dag dang yid rnams kyi nan tan du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni de'i don lus dang dag dang yid rnams kyi nan tan du byed pa'o //
translated: The line accomplishing means that one practices with body, speech, and mind the meaning of what one has understood.

original: shin tu rnyed par dka' zhes bya ba ni nan tan can gyis kyang tshogs chen pos rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rnyed par dka' zhes bya ba ni nan tan can gyis kyang tshogs chen pos rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The line very difficult to obtain means that even those who practice obtain it only with great difficulty.

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'dis lung dang rtogs pa las so sor thar pa'i rnyed par dka' ba bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa 'dis lung dang rtogs pa las so sor thar pa'i rnyed par dka' ba bstan te /
translated: Therefore, this verse shows the difficulty of obtaining liberation through scripture and realization.

original: thos pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni lung las so //
analyzed: thos pa dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni lung las so //
translated: Hearing and retaining it is through scripture.

original: sgrub pa ni rtogs pa las so //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni rtogs pa las so //
translated: Practice is through realization.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
translated: The appearance of Buddhas is happiness.

original: zhes bya @88b bya ba ni lhums su zhugs pa'i dus sam bltam pa'i dus na sangs rgyas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya @88b bya ba ni lhums su zhugs pa'i dus sam bltam pa'i dus na sangs rgyas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The appearance of Buddhas is at the time of entering the womb or at the time of birth.

original: phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' la sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Later, the Bodhisattva is called a Buddha by the way of appearance.

original: yang na mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus na sangs rgyas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus na sangs rgyas 'byung ba ste /
translated: Or, the appearance of Buddhas is at the time of full enlightenment.

original: de'i tshe sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i rgyu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par grol na dga' ba dang bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir gtsor ni de bde ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i rgyu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob pa'i phyir ro // rnam par grol na dga' ba dang bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir gtsor ni de bde ba ste /
translated: At that time, he is called a Buddha because he has attained omniscience, which is the cause of being called a Buddha.üîΩOr, liberation is happiness because it is the cause of joy and pleasure.

original: mi bde'o zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mi bde'o zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is primarily that which is happy, as in the expression ‚Äúhe is happy, not unhappy.‚Äù

original: chos bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mdo la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mdo la sogs pa gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is the explanation of the twelve branches of the scriptures, such as the Sutras.

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni skyes bu chen po gang zag brgyad do //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni skyes bu chen po gang zag brgyad do //
translated: The Sangha is the eight kinds of noble individuals.

original: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / cho ga dang / 'tsho ba mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / cho ga dang / 'tsho ba mtshungs pa ste /
translated: Harmony is the equality of morality, views, conduct, and livelihood.

original: bya ba gcig pa dang / tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bya ba gcig pa dang / tha mi dad pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: It is the same as the equality of action and the absence of division.

original: mthun pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Harmony is the purification of morality.

original: dka' thub ces bya ba ni bslab pa gsum bsgrub pa ste nyon mongs pa gdung bar byed pas dka' thub bo //
analyzed: dka' thub ces bya ba ni bslab pa gsum bsgrub pa ste nyon mongs pa gdung bar byed pas dka' thub bo //
translated: Austerity is the practice of the three trainings, because it burns up the afflictions.

original: de bas na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba de ni bde ba'i rgyur bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis dkon mchog gsum 'byung ba de ni bde ba'i rgyur bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this verse shows the appearance of the Three Jewels to be the cause of happiness.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / mi dge ba'i grogs po spong ba bde ba'i rgyur ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum pas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / mi dge ba'i grogs po spong ba bde ba'i rgyur ston to //
translated: The third verse shows the cause of happiness to be the reliance on spiritual benefactors and the avoidance of bad associates.

original: phyed gong ma dang phyed 'og ma dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: phyed gong ma dang phyed 'og ma dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The first half of the verse shows the wise, the second half shows the foolish.

original: sdig pa rnams las ring du song bas 'phags pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa rnams las ring du song bas 'phags pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The wise are called noble because they have gone far from evil.

original: dam pa dag ces bya ba ni 'phags pa de nyid de legs so zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa dag ces bya ba ni 'phags pa de nyid de legs so zhes ston pa'o //
translated: The word excellent shows that the noble are good.

original: byis pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa ma yin pa ste sdig pa byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: byis pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa ma yin pa ste sdig pa byed pa rnams so //
translated: The word foolish shows that the non-noble are evil-doers.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rab tu dbye ba ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bzhi pas ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rab tu dbye ba ston to //
translated: The fourth verse shows the classification of the spiritual teacher.

original: 'phags pa ni rnam pa gnyis te brdar btags pa dang don dam pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni rnam pa gnyis te brdar btags pa dang don dam pa'o //
translated: The noble are of two kinds: conventional and ultimate.

original: kun rdzob kyi yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The conventional are also of two kinds:

original: zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa dang / lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa'o//
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa dang / lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa'o//
translated: those who are bases of the branches of calm and those who are bases of the branches of insight.

original: de la / tshul khrims ldan pa mthong bas bad //
analyzed: de la / tshul khrims ldan pa mthong bas bad //
translated: Among them, one who has morality is seen to be happy

original: zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas kyi yan lag la gnas pa ste /
translated: shows the base of the branches of calm.

original: kun 'byung ba spangs pas sdig pa rnams las ring du song ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyi 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba spangs pas sdig pa rnams las ring du song ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyi 'phags pa'o //
translated: The conventional noble one is one who has gone far from evil by abandoning the origin of evil.

original: mang du thos pa mthong ba bde //
analyzed: mang du thos pa mthong ba bde //
translated: The one who has heard much is happy to see.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong gi yan lag la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the branch of insight.

original: phyed 'og @89a * //
analyzed: phyed 'og @89a * //
translated: The second half

original: mas ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtha' la gnas pa don dam pa'i 'phags pa ste dge ba'i bshes gnyen du ston to //
analyzed: mas ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtha' la gnas pa don dam pa'i 'phags pa ste dge ba'i bshes gnyen du ston to //
translated: teaches the ultimate noble one who is established in the limit of serenity and insight and is a spiritual friend.

original: dgra bcom pa ni 'khor bar me 'byung ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid de yang srid pa las rnam par gral bar ston to //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni 'khor bar me 'byung ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid de yang srid pa las rnam par gral bar ston to //
translated: The arhat is one who is liberated from existence, who has the characteristics of the phenomena that arise in samsara.

original: gzhan las rnam par grol ba ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las rnam par grol ba ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'o //
translated: Liberated from others refers to the nirvana without remainder.

original: zhes 'byung ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin phung po dang bcas pas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rang bzhin phung po dang bcas pas nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the nature of the truth of suffering, liberated from the bondage of affliction together with the aggregates.

original: 'jug dogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //
analyzed: 'jug dogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //
translated: The river of happiness is happy to enter.

original: zhes bya ba la rnam par grol ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rnam par grol ba ni /
translated: The river is liberation.

original: chu klung ste de mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chu klung ste de mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is attained by the path that abandons the two extremes, it is said to be happy.

original: 'jug dogs bde zhes bya ba dpe nye bar bstan pa'i tshig 'di bstan te /
analyzed: 'jug dogs bde zhes bya ba dpe nye bar bstan pa'i tshig 'di bstan te /
translated: This verse teaches the example.

original: ji ltar chu klung bde ba'i rgyu yin pas bde ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar chu klung bde ba'i rgyu yin pas bde ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Just as a river is happy because it is the cause of happiness, so also is the appearance of the Buddha, etc.

original: de bas na 'dis gong du bshad pa'i dbang gis thob par bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyur bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis gong du bshad pa'i dbang gis thob par bya ba ni bde ba'i rgyur bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that what is to be attained by the power of the above is the cause of happiness.

original: chos kyis rgyal ba'i skye bo bde //
analyzed: chos kyis rgyal ba'i skye bo bde //
translated: The people who are victorious through the Dharma are happy.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa dang bden pa bde ba'i rgyur bshad de bsgrub pa'i chos 'dis mi mthun pa'i phyogs pham par byas pas chos kyis rgyal pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa dang bden pa bde ba'i rgyur bshad de bsgrub pa'i chos 'dis mi mthun pa'i phyogs pham par byas pas chos kyis rgyal pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This teaches that practice and truth are the cause of happiness. By this Dharma of practice, the opposing side is defeated, so it is called the victory through the Dharma.

original: don 'di nyid phyed 'og ma la ston te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid phyed 'og ma la ston te /
translated: This very meaning is taught in the second half.

original: shes rab kyi ral gris nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ral gris nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sword of wisdom cuts down the banner of pride, the people who are victorious through the Dharma are happy.

original: tshigs su bcad pa drug pa las ni sgrub pa dang ldan pa de nyid sbyangs pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas bde ba'i rgyur bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa drug pa las ni sgrub pa dang ldan pa de nyid sbyangs pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas bde ba'i rgyur bstan to //
translated: The sixth verse shows that the very one who is endowed with practice is endowed with the perfection of the virtues of purification and is the cause of happiness.

original: nges par byas zhes bya ba ni bsam pa nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi thog ma'i dag pa ston to //
analyzed: nges par byas zhes bya ba ni bsam pa nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi thog ma'i dag pa ston to //
translated: The phrase having made a resolve shows the initial purity of the virtues of purification because it is the firm grasping of the intention.

original: mang du thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'bras bu dang bcas par ston te /
analyzed: mang du thos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'bras bu dang bcas par ston te /
translated: The phrase having much learning shows the fruit.

original: mang du thos pa ni de'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mang du thos pa ni de'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: One who has much learning is endowed with its fruit, but others are not.

original: dbang po dul ba dag ces bya ba ni yongs su spyod pa gtsang ba ste /
analyzed: dbang po dul ba dag ces bya ba ni yongs su spyod pa gtsang ba ste /
translated: The phrase tamed and peaceful in their senses shows the purity of conduct.

original: dbang po sdom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩzhi ba rnams su zhes bya ba ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // zhi ba rnams su zhes bya ba ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa rnams so //
translated: Because they are endowed with the restraint of the senses.üîΩThe phrase in solitary places shows the perfection of abode.

original: dgon pa rnams su zhes bya ba ni gnas pa bde zhes bya ba de dang 'brel to //
analyzed: dgon pa rnams su zhes bya ba ni gnas pa bde zhes bya ba de dang 'brel to //
translated: The phrase in forests is connected with the phrase in happy abodes.

original: rgas gyur rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgas gyur rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase having grown old shows the perfection of attendants.

original: gang du zhe na nags rnams su //
analyzed: gang du zhe na nags rnams su //
translated: Where? In the forests.

original: zhes bya ba 'di dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di dang 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: de bas na 'dis ni yongs su ma nyams pa'i dngos por bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni yongs su ma nyams pa'i dngos por bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this shows the state of non-degeneration.

original: rgas gyur rnams kyis zhes bya ba de nyid kyi don ni //
analyzed: rgas gyur rnams kyis zhes bya ba de nyid kyi don ni //
translated: As for those who have grown old, the meaning is the same as that.

original: dar la ba bas pa yol rnams kyi //
analyzed: dar la ba bas pa yol rnams kyi //
translated: Those who have passed beyond youthfulness.

original: @89b zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: @89b zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: This is what is shown.

original: gleng gzhi'i bsdus pa'i don ni lung dpog ba dang mi 'du ba dgag pa dang / mi 'dur gnang ba dang / mchod pa'i cho ga dang / yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phan yon dang / yang dag par mi 'dzin pa'i nyes dmigs dang /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i bsdus pa'i don ni lung dpog ba dang mi 'du ba dgag pa dang / mi 'dur gnang ba dang / mchod pa'i cho ga dang / yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phan yon dang / yang dag par mi 'dzin pa'i nyes dmigs dang /
translated: The summarized meaning of the nidana is: the prohibition of not transmitting the scriptures, the permission to not transmit, the ritual of worship, the benefits of correct retention, the disadvantages of incorrect retention,

original: yang dag par bsgo ba dang / 'khor rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgo ba dang / 'khor rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the correct transmission, and the pure retinue.

original: de la lung dbog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: de la lung dbog pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Regarding that, with regard to the empowerment of transmission,

original: 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, The past... and so on.

original: thal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means ashes.

original: so ga rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni dus gsum las gang yang rung ste gcig cig so sor thar pa 'don pa'i che brjod do ;üîΩ/ grang ba dang / dro ba dang / grang ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: so ga rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni dus gsum las gang yang rung ste gcig cig so sor thar pa 'don pa'i che brjod do ; / grang ba dang / dro ba dang / grang ba yang ma yin /
translated: The word ‚Äúsome‚Äù refers to any one of the three times, and the word ‚Äúrecite‚Äù refers to the recitation of the PrƒÅtimok·π£a.

original: dro ba yang ma yin pa las dus gsum du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dro ba yang ma yin pa las dus gsum du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The three times are established as cold, hot, and neither cold nor hot.

original: ji tsam gyi sgra ni tshad tsam ston te /
analyzed: ji tsam gyi sgra ni tshad tsam ston te /
translated: The word ‚Äúhow much‚Äù indicates a measure.

original: dus de dang mthun par brjod par bya'o //
